intro: Krynitzkia plebeia, commonly known as the common krynitzkia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters. Krynitzkia plebeia is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role in its native habitat.
